timeline.message: Check if there are no related streams in getAgeLimit()
Fix YoutubeStreamExtractor not being able to getAgeLimit() in onFetchPage()

timeline.bodyText: Did you mean two instead of do?
timeline.author: B0pol

timeline.message:
Fix tests

Except testGetFullLinksInDescription() in DescriptionTestUnboxing, since that requires other changes first.
Parse browseEndpoint and watchEndpoint in descriptions
Fix YoutubeChannelExtractor for channels without videos

Don't call getUploaderInfo() in onFetchPage() for playlists

This way YouTube Music playlists will keep working in NewPipe
Fix video titles consisting of multiple parts due to @
Fix channel descriptions consisting of multiple parts
Get Uploads view of Videos tab
Fix search queries with a promotedSparklesTextSearchRenderer returning 0 results
Actually fix thumbnail URLs starting with //

timeline.bodyText: Please do this in a separate method and add a test to check if the hard-coded client version is valid.
timeline.author: TobiGr

timeline.bodyText:
We might want to append response to the exception message. This could help us with debugging error reports later.
Apart from that, we could also add a
public static boolean isJsonResponseValid(String response) to YouTubeParsingHelper.
timeline.author: TobiGr

replies.bodyText:
We might want to append response to the exception message. This could help us with debugging error reports later.

I'll do that. The error message doesn't make sense (probably copied from somewhere), so I'll improve that as well.

Apart from that, we could also add a
public static boolean isJsonResponseValid(String response) to YouTubeParsingHelper.

Is that really needed for just response.length() < 50?
replies.author: wb9688

replies.bodyText: It is ok for now, but maybe we can validate a response in the future differently (and more accurate). We can leave it for now.
replies.author: TobiGr

replies.bodyText: YouTube returns {"reload":"now"} iirc if the client version is incorrect. I think this check isn't needed anymore now that we check whether the client version is valid and stuff in getClientVersion().
replies.author: wb9688

timeline.bodyText: Since you are using getVideoTab() many times in many functions, I'd suggest saving it in a variable on initialization, in order to speed up things
timeline.author: Stypox

timeline.bodyText: Could you extract these lines into a separate function taking just url as argument and returns initialData, put it in a common YouTube helper file, and use it whenever possible? I see it is being used in many places, and it's better to avoid duplicate code
timeline.author: Stypox

replies.bodyText: Yes, that was actually my plan, but I forgot about it. Thanks for reminding me.
replies.author: wb9688

timeline.author: Stypox

replies.bodyText: True, this probably happens at a lot of other places as well, but makes almost no difference.
replies.author: wb9688

timeline.author: Stypox

replies.author: wb9688
TobiGr

replies.bodyText: In terms of speed up this does not actually do much, but I think the second snippet provided by @TobiGr is more readable, since the indentation makes it clear that if the first method succeeds, the function will return that result immediately. With the current implementation you have to read and process more lines in order to understand that if the first method succeeds nothing else happens (i.e. there is no post processing or other things) @TobiGr @wb9688
replies.author: Stypox

timeline.bodyText: Same as above: since you often use getVideoPrimaryInfoRenderer(), it would be a good idea to save it in a variable
timeline.author: Stypox

timeline.bodyText: Why doesn't assertPageFetched() work anymore?
timeline.author: Stypox

replies.bodyText: Because getAgeLimit is (now indirectly) being called in onFetchPage().
replies.author: wb9688

timeline.bodyText: Same as above to save if checks and improve code readability, I'd move if (uploaderId == null) throw new ParsingException("Could not get uploader url"); at the end of the if just above
timeline.author: Stypox

timeline.bodyText: The result of this function should, too, being cached, since it is used many times
timeline.author: Stypox
Stypox

replies.bodyText: That's better indeed, though getAgeLimit() will only ever return 18.
replies.author: wb9688

timeline.author: Stypox
Stypox

timeline.bodyText: Isn't there a way to always get the uploader url in the "/channel/ID" form? This would make it consistent with other urls in the app, preventing bugs such as duplicate subscriptions
timeline.author: Stypox

replies.bodyText: Yes, there is I think. Edit: namely reverting that change.
replies.author: wb9688

replies.bodyText: @TobiGr: I don't think we should do that, as there are many other ways to get to a /user/name channel in NewPipe. Plus NewPipe could do a simple call to getId() or getUrl() in YoutubeChannelExtractor to get a /channel/id URL, if NewPipe isn't doing that already.
replies.author: wb9688

timeline.message: Check if hard-coded client version is valid in separate function
Add test to check whether hardcoded client version is still valid

timeline.bodyText:
This should be done using the
YoutubeChannelLinkHandlerFactory.getUrl(iploaderId, null, null) method. But it seems to be buggy to me. It does not return "https://www.youtube.com/channel/ID", but "https://www.youtube.com/ID". I searched for a small random channel (www.youtube.com/user/effectpl) and looked up its channelId (UCuyC5c8JXzPx71aMg7rGFgQ). While www.youtube.com/UCuyC5c8JXzPx71aMg7rGFgQ results in a 404 response,  www.youtube.com/channel/UCuyC5c8JXzPx71aMg7rGFgQ is valid.
Does anyone know, why it is implemented that way?
timeline.author: TobiGr

replies.bodyText: That's something I noticed as well. It appears that someone wants to have channel/UCwhatever as input there, so that it would also accept e.g. user/whatever URLs without having to do a conversion of some kind.
replies.author: wb9688

replies.bodyText: Ah yes, correct. That was the reason. Can you please add this info as Jdoc and use the method?
replies.author: TobiGr

timeline.bodyText: Is that a good idea? Because we are talking about channel name, something youtubers (can) change often & easily. Check for id would be better (unchangeable)
timeline.author: B0pol

replies.bodyText: You're right, except that there's no way to get an ID from a ChannelInfoItem.
replies.author: wb9688

replies.bodyText: The problem is T-Series showing up in the results, so that won't help. What would help is a break after the first channel is found that matches the subscriber criteria.
replies.author: wb9688

timeline.message: Catch NumberFormatException instead of checking whether viewCount equals "Recommended for you"

timeline.bodyText:
This string sometimes doesn't exist and we end up with https://www.youtube.comnull.
I think you mentioned in a comment above, and it seems like the browseId is returned everytime.
Would have to watch out though, because browseEndpoint seems like a generic response and maybe other types of items are returned as well.
It'd also help with the consistency of the /channel endpoint use, as some VEVO channels still return their canonicalBaseUrl using /user. Although you already told you opinion about this, it isn't always possible to call that method everywhere (for example: show the subscribe button in lists isn't the most reliable thing when this sort of thing happens), but meh, it's a limitation that we have to live with.
PS: Discovered with the improvements made in this PR: #265.
timeline.author: mauriciocolli
mauriciocolli

timeline.bodyText:
This fails when a video has no views because they are hidden.
For example, the Vox channel has some videos which fall in this case, like this one.
PS: Oddly enough, I went and checked the extractor for streams and for a surprise, there the views are actually available.  Oversight by YouTube I guess.
timeline.author: mauriciocolli
mauriciocolli

timeline.bodyText: Doesn't handle video premieres.
timeline.author: mauriciocolli
